snippet: Market makers who once might have stepped in during trading mishaps have largely been replaced by computers programmed to make lucrative high-frequency trades, Floyd Norris reported for The New York Times.
abstract: Market makers who once might have stepped in during trading mishaps have largely been replaced by computers programmed to make lucrative high-frequency trades, Floyd Norris reported for The New York Times.

headline.main: News Analysis:  An Automated Jolt for the Markets
